On Sat, 27 Sep 2003, Rakesh wrote:

> I have designed a set of test cases which I have added to a TestSuite.
> Now I want to run this TestSuite recursively.
...
> I have made my TestCases in such a way that setUp and tearDown will be
> called only once.
> So I would not like to call them again, once the TestSuite is over.
> I mean it should run with the current settings only.

Just to get things clear, please confirm that you mean something like
this:

public TestX extends TestCase {

   public void setUp () { ... }
   public void tearDown () { ...}

   public void testRecursively () {
        ...
        testRecursively();
   }
}

On the face of it, this should work.  JUnit will find testRecursively
and invoke it; testRecursively will then call itself.  Assertions
will succeed or cause exceptions; if they cause exceptions, recursion
stops.
